repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This manuscript belonged to Édouard-Simon Ariel's (1818-1854) collection. The author lists a total of 517 verb roots that are organized into seven different booklets according to their initial letter. Letters run from அ to ச.
Description based on the digitized version.

filiation.p: Indien 161 that is the second volume of Tamil verb roots.

p.p: As it occurs in manuscript Indien 194 from the same author, different kinds of paper can be found: a) brownish and thick paper; b) a light yellowish colour; or c) a darker yellowish colour paper.

Other two kinds of paper are represented by: a) a light blue colour and b) ruled paper. Examples of kind a) can be found at ff. 31, 38, 51, 56, 60, 75, 79, 126, 135, 161, 175, 192, 198, 217, 229, 253, 274, 312, 320, 329, 360, 367, 415, 430, 458, 499, 504, 505, 506, 529, 531, 532. Example of kind b) are found at ff. 204 and 377.

foliation.p: Foliation starts with the number one and it is regularly found on the upper right side of the recto of each folio. It goes from 1r to 432r.
There is only one occurrence in which there is another erased number next to the one representing the main foliation, e.g. ff. 170r (there is also number 396 or 376).

handNote.desc:
The handrwiting is difficult to read.
For some verb root, a corresponding Sanskrit form written in Devanagari script is provided. Examples may be found at: ff. 11r, 17r, 22r, 35v, 44r, 50r, 110r, 112r, 125r, 136r, 137r, 142r, 146r-v, 147r, 151r, 164r, 301r, 326r, 354r, 435r, 436r, 439r, 441r, 442r, 443r, 445r, 447r, 448r, 449r, 450r, 467r, 468v, 477r, 481, 500, 501, 503, 525r, 528r. Edouard Ariel.

additions.desc:
There are two different stamps found at the beginning and at the end of each booklet. The first one is a red circle containing an eagle and the writing Bibliothèque Impérial MSS. This is the stamp in use from 1852 to 1870 (cf. stamp n. 36 in Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282). The second one is a red oval containing the writing Don n°. Example of this combination can be found at: ff. 2r, 105r, 159r, 226r, 262r, 295r, 434r. The number of donation is not specified, however the handwriting, as well as the paper used allow to identify it as a manuscript belonging to Ariel whose collection was transferred from the Société Asiatique to the BnF in 1866 (Berthier 2000: 61).
In some other cases only the first stamp is found like in ff. 103v, 157v, 224v, 260v, 293v, 432v, 532v.
Two numbers of a previous cataloguing: 1. number 7481 written in pencil and crossed out with red colour; 2. number 159 written in substitution of the previous one in red colour.
f. 1r Radicaux tamils. அ.ஆ. It includes 101 verb forms.

binding.p: Hard paper covers, marbled on the outside. It is a collection of loose folios, sometimes of different size and colours, collected togheter.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Being a manusript by Ariel, the date of composition is based on his permanence in Pondicherry where he arrived in 1844 as a French Marine Officer after having studied with Eugène Burnof (1801-1852) in Paris (see James: 198-199).

acquisition.p: It entered the Bibliothèque National with Ariel's collection in 1866 (see Berthier 2000: 61).
